column1: 1 ^ Dòmine exáŭdi orațiónem meam~; áŭribus pèrcipe obsecrațiónem meam in veritáte tua~; exáŭdi me in tua justìția. ^ Hear
column3: my prayer~; give ear to my supplication in thy truth~; hear me in thy justice.

column1: 2 ^ Et non intres in judìcium cum servo tuo
column2: qụia non justificábitur in conspèctu tuo òmnis vívens. ^ And enter not into judgment with thy servant
column3: for in thy sight no man living shall be justified.

column1: 3 ^ Qụia persecútus est inimícus ánimam meam~; humiliávit in terra vitam meam. Collocávit me in obscúrîs sicut mórtuos sáĕculi. ^ For the enemy hath persecuted my soul~; he hath brought down my life to the earth. He hath made me to dwell in darkness as those that have been dead of old.
4 ^ Et anxiátus est super me spíritus meus~; in me turbátum est cor meum. ^ And my spirit is in anguish within me~; my heart within me is troubled.

5 ^ Mèmor fui diérum antiqụórum~; meditátus sum in òmnibus opèribus tuîs~; in factîs mánuum tuárum meditábar. ^ I remembered the days of old~; I meditated on all thy works~; I meditated upon the works of thy hands.
6 ^ Expándi manûs meas ad te~; ánima mea sicut terra sine aqụa tìbi. ^ I stretched forth my hands to thee~; my soul is as earth without water unto thee.

column3: defécit spíritus meus. Non avèrtas fáçiem tuam a me
column4: et sìmilis èro descendèntibus in lacum. ^ Hear me speedily
column5: O Lord~; my spirit hath fainted away. Turn not away thy face from me
column6: lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

column1: 8 ^ Aŭdítam fac mìchi mane misericórdiam tuam
column2: qụia in te sperávi. Notam fac mìchi viam in qụa ámbulem
column3: qụia ad te levávi ánimam meam. ^ Cause me to hear thy mercy in the morning~; for in thee have I hoped. Make the way known to me wherein I should walk
column4: for I have lifted up my soul to thee.

column3: ad te confúģi. ^ Deliver me from my enemies

column2: qụia Deus meus es tu. Spíritus tuus bonus dedúcet me in terram rectam. ^ Teach me to do thy will
column3: for thou art my God. Thy good spirit shall lead me into the right land.
vivificábis me. In aĕqụitáte tua edúces de tribulațióne ánimam meam
column6: thou wilt quicken me. In thy justice thou wilt bring my soul out of trouble

column1: 12 ^ et in misericórdia tua dispèrdes inimícos meos
column2: et pèrdes òmnes qụi trìbulant ánimam meam
column3: qụóniam ego sèrvus tuus sum. ^ and in thy mercy thou wilt destroy my enemies
column4: and thou wilt cut off all them that afflict my soul
